1.2. Physiological changes in pregnancy in women [11] 
Weight increases and changes body shape (due to increases in br east tissue, blood volume in the extra vascular and 
extra cellular fluid), the average weight gain in pregnancy is 12.5 kg. During normal pregnancy 1 kg weight due to 
protein. Fibrinogen levels are increased and total body fat also increased. The ratio of LDL and HDL increases in 
pregnancy. Increased cardiac output.
